text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm campy a technical customer
service specialist here at the AWS
office in Costa Rica today I am going to
show you how to find the resources that
are generating unexpected charges in an
AWS account let's get started there are
four reasons why the resources in
curring cost might not be noticeable for
you a first glance the first is you have
active resources in your account that
you are not aware of the quickest way to
find those resources is through the
bills page from the AWS billing and cost
Management console after logging in
navigate to the bill and
dashboard then choose bills you'll see
it on the left side of the screen
here you'll see a list of the services
that are incurring or have incured costs
on that specific month for example if
you see cloud trail listed on the bills
page and you choose it you'll see the
specific regions where the resources
were deployed and if you select the
region you'll see description of the
charge usage quantity and the amount
build keep in mind mind that when using
the Consolidated billing feature in AWS
organizations the bill speech view will
have two tabs the first is Consolidated
build details tab which shows the totals
for all the accounts in your AWS
organization and the second is the build
details by account tab to see the
activity for each account
separately now if you want to analyze
your data at a high level or create
custom reports use the AWS cost and
usage report or the AWS cost
Explorer three more reasons why
resources may be incurrent costs are the
charges are generated by resources on
another AWS account if you have more
than one email address check whether
those email addresses were used to
create another account if you are
signing in as an AWS identity and access
management user you might not have
permissions to view those resources ask
your account administrator to Grant you
permissions to view those
resources the resources generated
charges earlier in the month but have
been stopped or terminated when this
happens the AWS Management console for
that service will no longer show data of
those
resources however you can still find
usage information on the bills page the
cost and usage report or cost Explorer
as described at the beginning of this
video so now you know how to find the
resources that are generating unexpected
charges in an AWS account thanks for
watching and happy cloud computing from
all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
